title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,052.15 USD/T on February 4, 2026, down 1.71% from the previous day, and also reported at 3,074 USD/T, down 1.00%. Over the past month, prices have declined slightly but remain 17.08% higher than a year ago. Recent news highlights aluminum hitting a 4-week low at 3031.00 USD/T on February 2, 2026.

title: Aluminum Hits 4-week Low
summary: Aluminum decreased to 3031.00 USD/T, marking the lowest since January 2026. Over the past 4 weeks, prices gained 4.06%, and in the last 12 months, increased 20.13%. This reflects recent market volatility in the commodity.

title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now - February 2026 Metal Roofing Market Update
summary: The update discusses tight aluminum supply leading to four-year price highs in the US, driven by global deficits worsened in 2026 and US constraints. It covers impacts from ingot values, premiums, energy costs, and winter weather on production. Contractors are advised on risk mitigation amid lean inventories and pricing volatility.

title: US ALUMINUM: Extruders remain cautious for 2026 after an up-and-down 2025
summary: US aluminum extruders are cautious heading into 2026 following a mixed 2025 where early demand surges faded by mid-year, leading to drops in new business and shipments. Higher billet and tolling costs are expected, amid competition from imports and hopes for tariff reforms to boost demand. The Aluminum Association reports new orders up 5.1% but shipments down 1.4% through late 2025.

title: Aluminum Prices Soar to Four-Year High, Creating a Divide in U.S. Industry
summary: Aluminum prices on the LME have reached four-year highs, with US premiums exceeding $1 per pound, benefiting upstream producers like Alcoa and Century Aluminum while straining downstream manufacturers. Century Aluminum's Mt. Holly facility will add only 50,000 tons of capacity soon, insufficient to ease the supply deficit. Chinese producers profit from exports amid global tightness.

title: AISIN, Toyota Tsusho and Minth Agree to Establish a Joint Venture to Produce Aluminum Body Frame Parts in North America
summary: AISIN, Toyota Tsusho, and Minth are forming ATM Automotive Parts Inc. in Ontario, Canada, to produce aluminum body frame parts for BEVs and PHEVs using extrusion technology. The venture aims to strengthen North American supply amid rising demand for lightweighting and electrification. Ownership is split 40% AISIN, 20% Toyota Tsusho, 40% Minth.

title: Uzbekistan Launches Its First Aluminum Can Plant with IFC Support to Drive Sustainable Production
summary: Uzbekistan's East Can Solutions, with $18 million in IFC financing, has launched the country's first greenfield aluminum can production plant in Tashkent. The facility will produce up to 1.1 billion fully recyclable aluminum cans annually, create over 200 direct jobs, and use energy-efficient equipment to reduce emissions while strengthening domestic supply and reducing import reliance.

title: Can-ification: Aluminium's Role in Circular Packaging
summary: This article discusses aluminum cans as trusted solutions for sustainable beverage packaging, emphasizing their role in circular economy initiatives and sustainable packaging practices.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 971.06 USD/T on February 5, 2026, down 0.51% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 4.08%. Forecasts indicate trading at 986.72 USD/T by quarter-end and 1065.02 USD/T in 12 months.

title: Steel Prices Rising Again? February 2026 Metal Market Update
summary: Steel prices continue to rise with extended lead times at mills, influenced by energy costs and winter weather. Inventory levels remain lean across the supply chain. Contractors are advised to manage risks for Q1 and Q2 projects amid pricing volatility.

title: Feb 2026 Metals Market: Pricing, Supply & Buyer Insights
summary: Carbon and alloy steel markets remain balanced with spot pricing stable at ±2–4%. Price volatility of 3–8% has occurred since Q4 2025 due to energy costs and supply decisions. Buyers should evaluate Q2–Q3 needs amid tight inventories.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 05.02.2026
summary: Daily updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures Rebar terms and regional futures for Turkey, China, Europe, and North America as of February 3-4, 2026. Provides indices, analyses, and market comments.

title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now
summary: Steel market prices continue to rise at domestic mills with slightly increased production. Discussion covers rising steel prices, extended lead times, energy impacts, and lean inventories. Advice for contractors on managing projects and margins amid volatility.

title: US raw steel production is down 1.1 percent - week 5, 2026
summary: US raw steel production was 1.758 million net tons for the week ending January 31, 2026, down 1.1% from the prior week at 76.0% capacity utilization. Year-to-date production is up 3.4% from 2025.

title: US raw steel production is down 1.1 percent - week 5, 2026
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 31, 2026, was 1.758 million net tons at a capacity utilization rate of 76.0 percent, down 1.1 percent from the previous week. This represents a 3.4 percent increase from the same week in 2025. Adjusted year-to-date production through January 31, 2026, was 7.774 million net tons at 76.0 percent capacity utilization, up 3.4 percent year-over-year.

title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now - February 2026 Metal Roofing Market Update
summary: The video discusses rising steel mill prices, extended lead times, tight aluminum supply, and impacts from energy costs and winter weather on production. It highlights lean inventory levels across the supply chain and backlogs affecting steel delivery in January 2026. Contractors are advised to monitor the market closely for upcoming demand signals and pricing volatility.

title: MEPS's global steel production and capacity round-up
summary: The article provides a global overview of steel production and capacity updates. It mentions a pending decision in February 2026 on certain measures, effective from April 1, and proposals by the TRA to narrow the scope of investigations. This round-up covers key developments in the steel sector.

title: Copper Prices Pull Back Sharply, Downstream Users Replenish Stocks Moderately, Spot Premiums Rise Significantly [SMM Southern China Spot Copper]
summary: Spot copper prices in Guangdong fell sharply, with #1 copper cathode averaging 101,565 yuan/mt, down 3,075 yuan/mt from the previous day. Downstream users moderately replenished stocks amid the pullback, while traders actively purchased for arbitrage, leading to improved trading and significantly higher spot premiums. Guangdong inventory increased slightly due to higher arrivals.

title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid Demand Concerns
summary: Copper prices reversed earlier gains amid signs of softening demand, with LME inventories rising in Asian warehouses and extra spot cargoes moving from Africa to China. China's Nonferrous Metals Industry Association forecasts a 5% increase in refined copper output this year, dampening investor enthusiasm despite calls for strategic reserves. This bearish sentiment overshadows initial positive reactions to reserve-boosting suggestions.

title: Latest updates on metals prices worldwide at 0200 GMT, Feb. 5
summary: London Stock Exchange Group reported copper prices at 5.83 USD at 0200 GMT on Feb. 5. This update includes prices for other metals like gold at 4,988.00 USD and iron ore at 102.17 USD. The data reflects the latest worldwide metals pricing snapshot.

title: Refined copper output growth to slow in 2026: ICSG
summary: Copper output growth is expected to slow to 0.9% in 2026, down from 3.4% in 2025, according to Paul White at the World Copper Conference. World copper mine production is forecast to rise by 2.3%, while refined copper usage grows by 2.1%, leading to a 150,000-metric ton market deficit.

title: Physical Copper Gains Attention as Investors Seek Stability Amid Market Volatility
summary: Physical copper is gaining investor interest due to its role in electrification, renewables, EVs, and data centers amid supply constraints. Demand is rising with energy transition, while new mining projects face 10-15 year delays and declining ore grades. Analysts highlight risks of supply bottlenecks as structural demand surges.

title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid Demand Concerns
summary: Copper prices reversed gains due to softening demand signals, rising LME inventories in Asia, and extra supply from Africa to China. China's Nonferrous Metals Industry Association forecasts a 5% increase in refined copper output this year. This offsets earlier positivity from calls to boost strategic reserves.

title: Creation of a Leading Gold and Copper Producer
summary: Eldorado and Foran announce a transaction to combine into a leading gold and copper producer, with world-class projects like McIlvenna Bay and Skouries entering commercial production in mid-2026. The combined entity highlights high-margin free cash flow, strong balance sheet, and enhanced copper exposure from long-life assets. Emerging scanning technologies and orebody knowledge studies are redefining near-mine opportunities at McIlvenna Bay.

title: Teck Announces 2025 Production and Sales Update and Reaffirms Outlook
summary: Teck reports 2025 annual copper production of 453,500 tonnes, in line with guidance, supported by strong Q4 performance at Quebrada Blanca despite inventory buildup from weather delays. The company reaffirms 2026-2028 production guidance for operated sites, with updated zinc guidance for Antamina but unchanged copper production outlook. Focus remains on operational stability and progress toward steady-state production.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS enter a two-year agreement for AWS to use the first Nuton copper produced in U.S. data center components, emphasizing low-carbon production technology. Nuton represents an innovative approach to copper extraction aimed at sustainability. This collaboration supports sustainable supply chains for critical tech infrastructure.

title: It All Comes Back to Supply Chains
summary: The article discusses supply chain challenges in cleantech, highlighting Amazon Web Services' early 2026 strategic agreement with Rio Tinto to secure copper from Nuton technology. This deal underscores efforts to ensure sustainable, low-carbon copper supplies for data centers amid growing demand. It ties into broader themes of innovation and sustainability in critical mineral supply chains.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Drop Slightly on February 5 as US January ADP Employment Data Falls Short of Expectations
summary: On February 5, SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 139,850 yuan/mt, down 1,750 yuan/mt from the previous day, amid weak US ADP employment data. The SHFE nickel futures contract (2603) closed at 133,510 yuan/mt, down 1.79%. Despite macro pressures, expectations for reduced nickel ore quotas in Indonesia suggest potential future rebounds.

title: Nickel prices surge on Feb 5 amid concerns over trade war ease
summary: LME nickel futures rose by US$265/ton to close at US$15,535/ton on February 5. The nickel spot price also increased amid easing concerns over trade wars. This surge reflects positive market sentiment in the nickel sector.

title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel Sulphate Prices Edge Down as Chinese New Year Approaches Amid Weak Market Sentiment
summary: The SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index stood at 31,939 yuan/mt as of Thursday, with prices edging down ahead of Chinese New Year. Weak market sentiment contributed to the decline in nickel sulphate quotations. This reflects broader softening in nickel-related products.

title: Nornickel sees 2026 nickel output broadly in line with previous year
summary: Russia's Nornickel, the world's largest palladium producer and major nickel producer, expects 2026 nickel output of 193,000–203,000 metric tons, broadly in line with 2025 production of 198,521 tons. The company attributes recent production declines to ore reserve depletion and Western sanctions restricting equipment access, but expects recovery by 2028 through development of the Oktyabrskoye deposit.

title: Nickel Futures Rise from 1-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures rebounded to around $17,500 per tonne from a one-month low of $17,000, driven by tightening global supply conditions. Indonesia, the world's largest nickel ore producer, confirmed it will cut mining permits to 260 million wet tons in 2026 from 379 million tons in 2025, signaling reduced nickel feedstock availability.

title: Nickel Market at Inflection Point as Government Support Accelerates Western Projects
summary: Ardea Resources and Canada Nickel are advancing large-scale nickel development projects with government backing, with 2026-2027 construction milestones targeted. These Western projects aim to address supply constraints from Indonesia and reduce Chinese dominance in nickel supply chains, with Ardea's Goongarrie Hub alone holding 1.2 million tons of nickel reserves.

title: Robin Zeng: Unlocking the Sustainable Energy Era with Zero Carbon Technology
summary: Dr. Robin Zeng, Chairman and CEO of CATL, discussed the future of sustainable energy, highlighting renewable energy applications and grid-forming energy storage technology. CATL has achieved industry-leading recovery rates of 99.6% for nickel and cobalt, and 96.5% for lithium, demonstrating commitment to circular economy principles in zero-carbon energy systems.

title: Rare Earth Newsletter (February 2, 2026) - A Weekly Intelligence Brief
summary: This intelligence brief covers the U.S. critical minerals sector, noting 100% import reliance for 12 minerals and highlighting nickel's market volatility as a financing risk. The report identifies opportunities in stockpiling, diversification, and demand growth potential, with storage technology expected to outperform through 2030.

title: The first Energy Release contract in the Aosta Valley is underway: agreement signed between the CVA Group and Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: CVA will construct four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily with over 20 MW capacity, expected to produce 593,600 MWh fully operational by 2026. This marks the first Energy Release agreement in the Aosta Valley and supports the region's green energy transition and European Green Deal goals. Cogne Acciai Speciali will benefit from enhanced energy performance and reduced environmental impact through this partnership.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Strengthens Market Position with Acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes for Seamless Stainless Steel Pipes
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed the €135 million acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from German steelmaker Salzgitter. The acquisition significantly expands Cogne's market presence in seamless stainless steel and nickel alloy tubes, with facilities in Germany, France, Italy, and the USA being rebranded as DMV.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Dalmine, Tenaris's seamless steel pipe mill in Italy, has obtained ASME III certification for supplying materials to nuclear facilities. This accreditation enables Tenaris to participate in both new nuclear plant constructions and maintenance of existing ones globally. The certification supports the nuclear sector's role in low-carbon energy transition amid increasing decarbonization efforts.

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal, Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining pre-insulated pipeline systems and anti-corrosion coatings expertise in Europe. The unit has been rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, allowing coatings to be applied at Tenaris facilities in Italy, Mexico, Argentina, and Brazil. This move aims to reduce delivery times, ensure quality, cut costs, and lower environmental impact for the offshore market.

title: Pipe producer tightens its grip on giant Black Sea project with double contract win
summary: Tenaris secured a double contract win for the Sakarya Gas Project in the Black Sea. The contracts involve providing advanced tubular and pipeline solutions for Phase 3 development in ultra-deepwater conditions. This strengthens Tenaris's involvement in Turkey's major offshore gas initiative.

title: Tenaris wins supply deal for third phase of Sakarya gas field project
summary: Tenaris won a supply deal to provide essential equipment and services for Phase 3 of the Sakarya gas field project in the Black Sea's ultra-deep waters. The contract supports scaling production and extending the field's development. It includes offshore drilling casing with Dopeless dry-lubricant technology for improved efficiency and safety.
